messages.page_content:
- Topic: Roll Call and Quorum Establishment
- Summary: The roll call was conducted, and six members were present, constituting a quorum. Cm. Harris arrived later in the meeting.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
  Vote 1: N/A - (6 present, 1 absent)
- Decision/Key Actions: Quorum established for the meeting
- Tags/Keywords: Roll Call, Quorum, Attendance
- UID: c81527d3-aea1-4327-9646-3a78f70151c9

- Topic: Invocation
- Summary: Pastor Willie L. Calhoun from Fairview Baptist Church delivered the invocation.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
  Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Invocation delivered
- Tags/Keywords: Invocation, Pastor, Prayer
- UID: c81527d3-aea1-4327-9646-3a78f70151c9

- Topic: Amendment to Operating Budget for the City of New Orleans
- Summary: The ordinance aims to appropriate funds to the New Orleans City Council for an initiative to return funds to victims of crime who were charged to retrieve stolen property. The ordinance was discussed, and an amendment was proposed by Councilmember Moreno.
- Ordinance Number: 33,623
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Amendment to the ordinance was passed with a majority vote.
- Tags/Keywords: Budget, Appropriation, Crime Victims, Amendment
- UID: 100a3050-ba69-4d8c-9a2b-f44ecfdb8642

- Topic: Amendment to Ord. Cal. No. 33,623
- Summary: Councilmember Moreno introduced an amendment to increase the figure from 150,000 to 650,000 in multiple places within the ordinance.
- Ordinance Number: 33623 AMD 1
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Amendment - Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Amendment to increase the figure from 150,000 to 650,000 was passed.
- Tags/Keywords: Amendment, Budget Committee, Councilmember Moreno
- UID: 0fd4a3f8-3e98-41cb-9cb9-9a5cf37d305d

- Topic: Amendment to Ord. Cal. No. 33,623
- Summary: Councilmember Green introduced an amendment, followed by a motion to accept the amended ordinance.
- Ordinance Number: 33623 AMD 2
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Amendment - Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
    Vote 2: Motion to Accept as Amended - Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Amendment introduced by Councilmember Green passed, followed by the motion to accept the amended ordinance.
- Tags/Keywords: Amendment, Councilmember Green, Motion to Accept as Amended
- UID: 0fd4a3f8-3e98-41cb-9cb9-9a5cf37d305d

- Topic: Amendment to Operating Budget for the City of New Orleans
- Summary: The ordinance aims to appropriate funds to the New Orleans City Council to fund an initiative returning funds to victims of crime charged to retrieve stolen property. An amendment was proposed to change the verbiage from "New Orleans City Council" to "Chief Administrative Office."
- Ordinance Number: 33624
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Amendment - Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The amendment was passed to change the verbiage in the ordinance.
- Tags/Keywords: City of New Orleans, Operating Budget, Amendment, Councilmember Moreno
- UID: 9ef5a03f-d96e-4f28-bda9-03835f9b9c4d

- Topic: Amendment to Increase Funding Allocation
- Summary: The ordinance proposed to increase the funding allocation from $150,000 to $650,000, as detailed in the specified lines on page 1 and 2.
- Ordinance Number: 33624 AMD 2
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Amendment - Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
    Vote 2: As Amended - Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The amendment to increase funding allocation was passed.
- Tags/Keywords: Funding, Amendment, Increase, Council Meeting, Allocation
- UID: dffc926e-8248-407c-a389-d0944a266c5a

- Topic: Resolution on Gender Equality and Inclusion
- Summary: The resolution aimed to demonstrate the City Council's commitment to equality, inclusion, and acceptance of people of all gender identities and expressions, affirming their right to dignity, respect, and equitable access to opportunities.
- Ordinance Number: R-22-134
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Adopt - Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The resolution on gender equality and inclusion was adopted.
- Tags/Keywords: Resolution, Gender Equality, Inclusion, Council Meeting, Commitment
- UID: dffc926e-8248-407c-a389-d0944a266c5a

- Topic: Adoption of Findings and Recommendations of Repetitive Loss Area Analysis
- Summary: The council adopted the findings and recommendations of the Repetitive Loss Area Analysis to be incorporated into the city’s Hazard Mitigation and Floodplain Management Programs.
- Ordinance Number: R-22-135
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Adoption of findings and recommendations
- Tags/Keywords: Hazard Mitigation, Floodplain Management, Resilience
- UID: cf55d4fd-fd36-4609-9113-0357c63973c6

- Topic: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement for Carrollton Power Plant
- Summary: The ordinance authorized the Mayor to enter into a Cooperative Endeavor Agreement with the Sewerage and Water Board for the purpose of improving and maintaining the resiliency and reliability of power generated at the Carrollton Power Plant for the benefit of the city's infrastructure and citizens' safety.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,648
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Authorization of Cooperative Endeavor Agreement
- Tags/Keywords: Infrastructure Resilience, Power Generation, Public Safety
- UID: cf55d4fd-fd36-4609-9113-0357c63973c6

- Topic: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement for Promoting Public Art
- Summary: The ordinance authorizes the Mayor to enter into a Cooperative Endeavor Agreement with the Arts Council of New Orleans to promote public art by establishing procedures and funding for the execution and acquisition of works of art in public places in the city.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,649
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted with unanimous support from the council members.
- Tags/Keywords: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement, Public Art, Mayor, Arts Council, Funding
- UID: c2883339-e43d-48bf-8d24-9a0abdc61317

- Topic: Presentation of George Washington Carver High School Basketball Team and Coaches
- Summary: A presentation to congratulate the local high school basketball team and coaches on their championship season.

- Topic: Recognition of New Orleans Dolphins 14U Seven-on-Seven Football Team

- Topic: Appeal for Demolition Decision (7327 S. Claiborne Avenue)
- Summary: Matthew Fox of M. Fox Design requested to appeal the Historic District Landmarks Commission’s decision of "no action vote" regarding the demolition of 100% of an existing flat roof structure with plans to add a second floor to the existing home located at 7327 S. Claiborne Avenue.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary: Not applicable
- Decision/Key Actions: The appeal was electronically submitted and received, with a hearing date set for 4/7/22.
- Tags/Keywords: Demolition appeal, Historic District Landmarks Commission, hearing date

- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary: Not applicable

- Topic: Amendment to Operating Budget of Revenues for the City of New Orleans for the Year 2021
- Summary: Councilmember Giarrusso introduced an ordinance to amend the Operating Budget of Revenues for the City of New Orleans for the Year 2021 to appropriate state grant funds from Intergovernmental Transfers to the Mayor’s Office of Workforce Development for the 2021 National Disaster Dislocated Worker grant program.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,635
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Referred to the Budget Committee
    Vote 2: Referred back to the Budget Committee
- Decision/Key Actions: Referred to the Budget Committee for further consideration and review.
- Tags/Keywords: Budget, Operating Budget, Grant Funds, Workforce Development
- UID: 6f35ab04-cffc-4b4e-b89f-5242b0b09b89

- Topic: Amendment of Operating Budget for Workforce Development
- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend the operating budget to appropriate Federal Dislocated Worker Funds for workforce development in the area affected by Hurricane Ida. The Budget Committee recommended approval, and the ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33635 - 28973 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: Amendment of operating budget approved to allocate Federal Dislocated Worker Funds for workforce development.
- Tags/Keywords: Operating budget, Federal funds, Workforce development, Hurricane Ida, Budget Committee
- UID: 79710e21-0bcd-4d8b-9f30-3f30b9838cd6

- Topic: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement for Lafitte Greenway
- Summary: The ordinance authorizes the Mayor to enter into a Cooperative Endeavor Agreement between the City, NORD, and Friends of Lafitte Greenway to maximize the Lafitte Greenway for public recreational use. The Budget Committee recommended approval, and the ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33636 - 28974 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: Authorization for Cooperative Endeavor Agreement approved to enhance public recreational use of the Lafitte Greenway.
- Tags/Keywords: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement, Lafitte Greenway, Recreational use, Budget Committee
- UID: 79710e21-0bcd-4d8b-9f30-3f30b9838cd6

- Topic: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement for Lafitte Greenway
- Summary: The ordinance, introduced by multiple council members, aims to authorize the Mayor to enter into a Cooperative Endeavor Agreement between the City, NORD, and Friends of Lafitte Greenway to maximize the Lafitte Greenway for public recreational use. The Budget Committee recommended approval, and the ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33640 - 28976 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: Authorization for Cooperative Endeavor Agreement approved to enhance public recreational use of the Lafitte Greenway.
- Tags/Keywords: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement, Lafitte Greenway, Recreational use, Budget Committee
- UID: 79710e21-0bcd-4d8b-9f30-3f30b9838cd6

- Topic: Amendment of Operating Budget for Gas Utility Assistance Programs
- Summary: The ordinance aimed to appropriate ARPA funds to support gas utility assistance programs and reduce gas utility costs for residential gas customers in New Orleans. The ordinance was electronically submitted, recommended for approval by the Budget Committee, and ultimately adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33654 - 28981 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
  Vote 1: Adopt - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted.
- Tags/Keywords: ARPA funds, gas utility assistance, budget amendment
- UID: bc4064da-9e43-4aa6-bf28-d5dced0900ab

- Topic: Appropriation of ARPA Funds for Gas Utility Assistance Programs
- Summary: This ordinance sought to appropriate ARPA funds to support gas utility assistance programs and reduce gas utility costs for residential gas customers in New Orleans. It was electronically submitted, recommended for approval by the Budget Committee, and ultimately adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33655 - 28982 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
  Vote 1: Adopt - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted.
- Tags/Keywords: ARPA funds, gas utility assistance, budget appropriation
- UID: bc4064da-9e43-4aa6-bf28-d5dced0900ab

- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)

- Summary: The ordinance requested a conditional use for a minor motor vehicle service and repair facility in an S-B1 Suburban Neighborhood Business District. The City Planning Commission recommended approval with eleven provisos.

- Votes Summary:

- Topic: Exterior Door Closure After Sunset
- Summary: The ordinance requires exterior doors facing public rights-of-way to be kept closed after sunset each day.
- Ordinance Number: 18
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (8 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 2 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with a majority vote.
- Tags/Keywords: Public Safety, Noise Control
- UID: 69c27092-97ea-4002-9a67-23e91040a135

- Topic: Prohibition of Attached Speakers
- Summary: This ordinance prohibits the attachment of speakers to any exterior surface of the building.
- Ordinance Number: 19
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 1 NAYS, 2 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with a majority vote, with some dissent.
- Tags/Keywords: Noise Control, Public Nuisance
- UID: 69c27092-97ea-4002-9a67-23e91040a135

- Topic: Amplified Music Direction
- Summary: The ordinance requires any source of amplified music to be directed to the interior of the establishment and not towards any public right-of-way.
- Ordinance Number: 20
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (9 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 1 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed unanimously.
- Tags/Keywords: Noise Control, Public Nuisance
- UID: 69c27092-97ea-4002-9a67-23e91040a135

- Topic: Conditional Use Request for ZD NO. 110/21
- Summary: The motion M-22-129 involved overruling and granting the conditional use request as recommended by the City Planning Commission's report on ZD NO. 110/21 with modifications. Proviso No. 1 was removed, and nineteen additional provisos were added. The motion passed.
- Ordinance Number: M-22-129
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Conditional use request granted with modifications

- Topic: Litter Abatement Program for Bar Owners
- Summary: The ordinance required bar owners to provide a litter abatement program letter approved by the Department of Sanitation and inclusive of specified details. The plans submitted to the City Planning Commission for final approval were also required to indicate the installation of bicycle racks. No specific voting outcome was mentioned in the provided information.
- Ordinance Number: Not mentioned
- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Requirements for litter abatement and bicycle rack installation outlined
- UID: 542ec014-6a6f-4980-af7f-6cdd78aacdfe

- Votes Summary:

- Votes Summary:

- Summary: Requesting a text amendment to classify "animal hospital" as a permitted use in the HU-B1A Historic Urban Neighborhood Business District Citywide. The recommendation of the City Planning Commission was "FOR APPROVAL".
